summary: An "interparliamentary delegation" refers to a group formed by members of various national parliaments within the European Union, aimed at fostering dialogue and cooperation on legislative matters. This concept is integral to enhancing parliamentary oversight and ensuring that national interests are represented in EU decision-making processes. Interparliamentary delegations facilitate exchanges of views on critical issues, thereby reinforcing the democratic legitimacy of EU institutions. They play a pivotal role in the regulatory framework, allowing for a more cohesive approach to transnational challenges and promoting collaborative governance among member states.
